lines.text: Attendance at Board Meetings and at Annual General
Matters requiring the Board's attention / approval, as
emanating from the Board Committee meetings, are
placed before the Board by the respective Committee
Chairman. The role and composition of these
Committees, including the number of meetings held
during the financial year and the related attendance, are
The Audit Committee of the Board, inter alia, provides
reassurance to the Board on the existence of an effective
efficiency and effectiveness of operations, both
safeguarding of assets and adequacy of provisions
reliability of financial and other management
The Audit Committee is empowered, pursuant to its
terms of reference, inter alia, to:
. investigate any activity within its terms of reference
and to seek any information it requires from any
obtain legal or other independent professional advice
and to secure the attendance of outsiders with relevant
The role of the Committee includes the following:
(a) Overseeing the Company's financial reporting process
and the disclosure of its financial information to ensure
that the financial statements are correct, sufficient
(b) Recommending the appointment and removal of
external auditors, fixation of audit fee and approval
of payment of fees for any other services rendered
(c) Reviewing with the management the financial
Currently, there are five Board Committees - the Audit
statements before submission to the Board, focusing
Committee, the Compensation Committee, the Investor
Services Committee, the Nominations Committee and
Any changes in accounting policies and practices
the Sustainability Committee. The terms of reference of
the Board Committees are determined by the Board
from time to time. Meetings of each Board Committee
Major accounting entries based on exercise of
are convened by the respective Committee Chairman.
